results.title: Concerto for orchestra
results.creator_credit: Robert Parker, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The life and work of members of the Sydney Symphony Orchestra and its resident conductor, Dean Dixon, the off-duty hobbies and pastimes of members of the orchestra, ranging from surf fishing and motor racing to violin making and chess. Highlight is an invitation by the conductor to kindergarten children to play the instrument of their choice. Features music of Bela Bartok.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Parker, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: The Coalminer
results.creator_credit: Peter Dimond, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Gives something of the history of coal mining in Australia and shows modern machinery, methods and amenities.

results.title: The Cleaners
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Wallhead, State Film Centre of Victoria and Malcolm Wallhead Film Productions
results.brief_description: Opening with views of the city of Melbourne in the early morning, we see the crowds of workers arriving by train and tram. During the day the streets are crowded with people who dispose of rubbish without thought, necessitating an army of cleaners to keep the city clean. Day and night the cleaning goes on, in the early morning the main body of cleaners take over making the city ready for the day to come.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Malcolm Wallhead, State Film Centre of Victoria and Malcolm Wallhead Film Productions

results.title: The Change at Groote
results.creator_credit: Stefan Sargent, Richard Mason and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Designed to show how the aboriginal people of Groote Eylandt in the Gulf of Carpentaria are adjusting to the new life brought about by the discovery on their lands of vast manganese deposits which are now being mined by Broken Hill Proprietary. Made as a fragmented collage of images and sounds, it is intended to produce a direct emotional response, and suggest the confused values of the aboriginals undergoing a social and cultural revolution.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stefan Sargent, Richard Mason and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Caulfield: a Living City
results.creator_credit: John Freney-Mills, Ewart Wade, Caulfield City Council and Caulfield Film Society
results.brief_description:
Weekend activities in the City of Caulfield. Schools, churches, sporting and social service groups keep the city alive at weekends. Activities include the running of the Caulfield Cup, and quieter games such as tennis and bowls. School children learn road safety at special classes and attend the Youth Centre. For the elderly citizens there are “meals-on-wheels”.

results.title: The Car Stealers
results.creator_credit: Eric L. Morris, Geoffrey Thompson, Council of Fire and Accident Underwriters and Cine Services
results.brief_description: Dramatizes the problem of car theft and joy-riding by young teenagers in Australia. Points out to car owners and parents how their carelessness can be partly responsible. Shows safety devices and security checks for car-owners. Made with the co-operation of the Victorian Police.

results.title: The Canberra Lake: Springtime sixty-four
results.creator_credit: Visatone (Australia), Neil Howe and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Canberra, the national capital of Australia, has a man-made lake in the centre of the city. We see a working model of the lake, dam, flood-gates, various transport routes and bridges. The lake, designed by Walter Burley Griffin, was opened at the end of 1964. Shows the official opening and the use of the lake for water sports.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Visatone (Australia), Neil Howe and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Camberwell Junction
results.brief_description: Made by Ivan Gaal, this film is in three parts. Still photographs of ‘past…definite’ are accompanied by sounds of horses hooves. ‘Present…indicative’ shows speeded up traffic during the day and night, making it difficult for people to cross the roads. ‘Future…indefinite’ poses a question mark.

results.title: Born in the sun
results.creator_credit: John Heyer and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows the development of the dried fruits industry at Mildura from the time of Deakin’s irrigation bill, and highlights the part irrigation has played. Includes a dramatised extract of an Alfred Deakin speech. The film shows climatic setbacks which the industry has experienced. Illustrates the harvesting, processing and distribution of the fruit.

results.title: Blue Ice
results.creator_credit: Phillip Garth Law, Film Australia and External Affairs
results.brief_description: A record of the 1954 Australian National Antarctic Research Expedition, which relieved the scientific stations at Macquarie and Heard Islands and established a new station at Mawson on MacRobertson Land in Australian Antarctic Territory. The film describes the expedition’s departure from Melbourne in December 1953 and follows its 12,000 mile journey through high seas and pack ice, providing an insight into daily life at the stations and the challenges presented by often-difficult conditions. There is stunning footage of towering icebergs and masses of penguins as well as aerial reconnaissance and surveillance.
